name: Kikou Keisatsu Metal Jack
description:
Kikou Keisatsu Metal Jack is a scrolling brawler based on the anime of the same name. At the start of the game the player can choose from Red Jack, Silver Jack, or Blue Jack. Red and Silver both have weapons they can find ammo for in levels (a gun and baton, respectively), and all three can do a multiple hit combo or a jumping attack. At the end of a level the Jack will be met by his vehicle which will then merge with his armor. In this form the Jack's attacks are strengthened and he can charge up an attack that hits every enemy onscreen.

There is no story told at any point in the game, so if you want to know what's going on you'll have to track down the anime.

shot.caption: Title Screen
If senton bombing isn't the answer...
...then Blue Jack doesn't understand the question.
These para-military folk only show up in this one hallway.
Likewise, this is the only appearance of these drones in the entire game.
Blue Jack meets up with his vehicle.
A short cutscene that accompanies the end of level transformation.
Now we're ready to make someone's day.
Charging up Blue Jack's special move.
And then unleashing it on a poor boss monster.
The sewer level is crawling with leaping street punks.
Switching over to Silver Jack to take care of this bruiser.
Silver packs a powerful sword.
Boss #2: Ninjas that hop about and make only the barest attempts to hurt you.
These mud monsters can only hurt you if you walk right into them. The best defense is to stand still until they run away.
Stage 3's midboss crouches and jumps while extending his limbs up to half the length of the screen.
Boss#3. His rushes, stabs, and bullets will almost always miss a crouching opponent.
Stage 4 introduces the most dangerous enemy type in the game: bottomless pits.
Yet another enemy that hasn't quite mastered the concept of aiming.
This evil Jack will bait you into hitting him before triangle jumping over the entire screen.
Oh, well, this is awkward.
And somehow he's made this even more awkward.
Excessive force is my favorite kind of force.
Getting hit by that lighting, or anything, will reset the charge time for special attacks.
